GOVERNMENT in Britain and some other countries, the government department that is responsible for the country's finances, including tax levels and how much money the government can spend: Cuts in duty will cost the Exchequer £1.75 billion. The industry claims it contributes to the Irish exchequer because it generates employment and wealth. See also
Chancellor of the Exchequer
